title: Blue Jackets fire coach Richards, hire Tortorella: Report | REPORT | Hockey | Sp
text:
One of hockey's most entertaining characters is heading back behind an NHL bench, according to multiple reports.
John Tortorella has been hired by the Columbus Blue Jackets, TSN reports , replacing Todd Richards, fired just seven games into the 2015-16 season.
Since Tortorella is still under contract with the Vancouver Canucks, Columbus will send a second-round draft pick out west in exchange as compensation for bringing on the bench boss, according to Sportsnet .
The Canucks canned Tortorella last May, only one season into a five-year, $10-million deal.
The fiery 57-year-old guided the Tampa Bay Lightning to the 2004 Stanley Cup and will coach the under-23 North American all-stars team at the World Cup of Hockey next year.
The Blue Jackets, at 0-7, are off to a horrid start this season. Its goal differential (-21) is by far the worst in the entire league.
Promoted to head coach in 2011-12 after a season as an assistant, Richards helped Columbus make the playoffs once in four tries.
